A bicycle manufacturing company is implementing Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
Define the reservation principle for paint: You should set the reservation principle to Start. This
means that inventory is reserved when production starts3. This way, you can ensure that paint is
available at the production station when needed

Answer is correct. In the Item model group, under inventory policies, you can activate the override item production reservation and set to manual. Since the paint should always be available at the production location, it should never require picking work.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/supply-chain/production-control/override-default-reservation-principle#:~:text=On%20the%20other%20hand%2C%20if%20you%20have%20materials%20or%20ingredients%20that%20don%27t%20require%20pick%20work%2C%20because%20they%20are%20consumed%20directly%20from%20a%20location%2C%20you%20typically%20select%20the%20manual%20reservation%20principle%2C%20which%20doesn%27t%20make%20any%20physical%20reservations%20or%20generate%20any%20pick%20work.

comments.content: Looks like we don't want to reserve the paint since it is already on the production location ready to be consumed. We must reserve the other parts in the warehouse. Since reservation on the production order will give all BOM lines same reservation principle we can’t reserve on production order. Therefore, Question A must be Item model group, B Manual.
